physical_appearance:This is a black-and-white photograph. It is rectangular in shape and landscape in orientation. It features a natural landscape
 with an open field in the foreground
 and a forested area in the background. There is a section of a water body on the left of the photograph. There are no individuals seen in the photograph. There are no inscriptions. There are no tears or folds seen.

subject_terms_4:
sgcool_label_text:This is a personal photograph album that belonged to a Corporal A. Silver who spent 16 months in Singapore between 1951 and 1952. Silver was presumably a Jewish lady who was stationed in Singapore to serve at the Royal Air Force (RAF) Hospital at Changi. The album contains photographs that document her working and personal life
 including friends she made within the Jewish community in Singapore.

metadata.title_text: "Personal photograph album titled ""Sixteen Months in Singapore""" Sixteen Months in Singapore: Photograph of natural landscape
metadata.physical_appearance: This is a black-and-white photograph. It is rectangular in shape and landscape in orientation. It features a natural landscape, with an open field in the foreground, and a forested area in the background. There is a section of a water body on the left of the photograph. There are no individuals seen in the photograph. There are no inscriptions. There are no tears or folds seen.
metadata.sgcool_label_text: This is a personal photograph album that belonged to a Corporal A. Silver who spent 16 months in Singapore between 1951 and 1952. Silver was presumably a Jewish lady who was stationed in Singapore to serve at the Royal Air Force (RAF) Hospital at Changi. The album contains photographs that document her working and personal life, including friends she made within the Jewish community in Singapore.
